solution_line_template: Dave weighs {dave_weight} pounds and can bench press three times his body weight, so he can bench press {dave_weight}*{dave_multiplier} = <<{dave_weight}*{dave_multiplier}={dave_bench}>>{dave_bench} pounds

Craig can only bench press {craig_percent_num}% of Dave's {dave_bench} pounds, so Craig can bench press {craig_percent_decimal}*{dave_bench} = <<{craig_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{dave_bench}={craig_bench}>>{craig_bench} pounds

Craig bench presses {craig_bench} pounds and Mark does {mark_less} pounds less than Craig, so Mark can only press {craig_bench}-{mark_less} = <<{craig_bench}-{mark_less}={mark_bench}>>{mark_bench} pounds
